intro: Licaria monsalveae, commonly known as the Colombian licaria, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
